title: Which aircraft was the most effective during WW2? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let me introduce to you, exhibit A the zero:  This fighter was the bread & butter for the Japanese Air Force and Navy. While eventually being down-classed for kamikaze service, this fighter beat out American air ten times out of ten. They served at Pearl Harbor, the Philippines, Midway, Indo-China, and many others. Again it was eventually out classed by latter fighters, this plane scored the most kills or any fighter craft in the Pacific theater. American pilots would tremble in fear when the characteristic noise flew into their ears. What was even more devastating was the Kamikaze bombings. They zero was again used to great effect on American ships, destroying dozens with suicidal pilots. This fighter will forever be known for its dedication to its emperor. No matter what the cost.

I believe the most effective aircraft of WW2 was probably the DH Mosquito. It was the most effective at everything it did, and it did a lot of different things. 1) night-fighter, easily the best. 2) Long range, high level light bomber, 4000 lb to Berlin at 36,000 ft. 3) Fighter-bomber heavily armed high low level speed, 4 x 20 mm cannon and 4 x .303 mgs, carried 60 lb rockets, a 57 mm auto cannon, or bombs. 4) Low level precision light bomber, bombs thru windows at low level. 5) High speed long range recce at 40,000 ft. 6) Master bomber of Bomber Command’s night bombing campaign - marked targets for the Pathfinders to illuminate the target for 600–800 bombing raids.

Take your pick: Bf-109: OWNED the skies over Europe, 1939–42 Hurricane: broke the back of the LW bomber force in the BoB, 1940 Spitfire: terrorized the Jagdwaffe in the BoB, 1940 A6M Zero: OWNED the skies over the Pacific, 1941–42 SBD Dauntless: broke the back of the IJN carrier force at Midway, 1942 Mosquito: nigh-untouchable, for most of the war, 1942–45 B-24 Liberator: closed the mid-Atlantic ASW gap, 1942–45 Il-2 Sturmovik: pounded the Panzerwaffe from Stalingrad to Berlin, 1942–45 P-51 Mustang: broke the back of the Jagdwaffe over Germany, 1944–45 B-29 Superfortress: just ask Hiroshima and Nagasaki, 1945 There are a host of others (Beaufighter, Ju-88, D3A Val, P-38 Lightning, F4U Corsair, to name but a few) who could also claim the title.

The Il-2 turned the tide of WW2 on the Eastern Front against Hitler’s armies, the B-17, B-24, and P-51 pounded the Germans into submission by laying waste to the industrial heartland of the Third Reich, while the B-29 laid waste to Japan, and fighter planes like the Dauntless, Corsair, Avenger, Hellcat, and Helldiver played a role in bringing about the downfall of the Imperial Japanese Navy during the Battles of Midway, Guadalcanal, and Leyte Gulf. As for Axis aircraft, the Ju 87 Stuka crushed Poland’s armies through dive-bombing, while the Fw 200 sunk many Allied merchant ships in the Atlantic.

I’ll take the C-47 Dakota, the military version of the legendary-on-its-own DC-3. Eisenhower named it as one of the Allies’ four ‘war-winning tools,” along with the bazooka, the Jeep and atomic weapons. I’ve noticed that aviators, almost all of them, can get nearly misty-eyed when talking about the rugged reliability of the Dakota.

Which aircraft was capable at what? This question is very poorly worded and/or thought out. A Lancaster was a very capable heavy night bomber, but not very capable as a carrier launched torpedo bomber. I suspect the questioner means best all round aircraft, if so my suggestion would be the Dehavilland Mosquito.  It was used as a pathfinder, medium nightbomber, daylight bomber, reconnaissance, night fighter, night intruder, anti shipping (die were fitted with a 6pdr anti tank gun) ground attack, high speed transport (it could carry two people in the bomb bay) anti V1 interceptor… there’s probably more. Not bad for a wooden aircraft rejected by the Air Ministry when first proposed.

This question has no sense. Different class of planes have different roles. You cannot compare a fighter to strategic bomber and saying the B-17 is more capable than a P-51. The P-51 has much less and different firepower but it has fighter capabilites while B-17 had 0 fighter features.
